newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: FOODCORP LEATHER UNIT SOLD FOR 52.5MLN RAND.
newsitem.headline: FOODCORP LEATHER UNIT SOLD FOR 52.5MLN RAND.

text.p: Foodcorp Ltd announced on Thursday it had sold its Hanni Leathers division to Seton South Africa, a subsidiary of Seton Company of the U.S., for 52.5 million rand.

The company said in a statement the price would be settled by a cash payment of 19.7 million rand and the issue to Foodcorp of stock in Seton Company to the value of 19.7 million rand, as well as 25 percent of the share capital of Seton South Africa Ltd.
Seton Company of the U.S. is the largest automotive leather producer in the world.
The transaction would not have a material effect on Foodcorp's results for the year to August 31 1997, Foodcorp chief executive officer Dave Kennealy said.
